
Alice encrypted her secret with RSA, but accidentally chose a modulus made from two Blum primes. Can you recover her message?
4588918221330087263478494524307411229044806987916607667402392806965453024165142489788043029802793972755096545399789724860515326143137090224039771312741186

n=9095021952017353260207344546428484182268232693666839504399050821643359000943569608778772187651807787639897955860687636371208890972068119307463947888358689, e=2609051269284975731706820094915882031984987357387779807592630054941117555653199550100608458244198083558880216046341421146952753902831500089091203497817621
The lower 104 bits of p are: 16711732344434691766844063327616192171


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{znl2zzg9}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4588918221330087263478494524307411229044806987916607667402392806965453024165142489788043029802793972755096545399789724860515326143137090224039771312741186
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9095021952017353260207344546428484182268232693666839504399050821643359000943569608778772187651807787639897955860687636371208890972068119307463947888358689, e=2609051269284975731706820094915882031984987357387779807592630054941117555653199550100608458244198083558880216046341421146952753902831500089091203497817621
The lower 104 bits of p are: 16711732344434691766844063327616192171

extra_info: p=98304497674841290557165748369347372895643093181745449141012195895241113816747, q=92518879269396936878125804713884559125017578939532141404265986488768794041187, Ï†(n)=9095021952017353260207344546428484182268232693666839504399050821643359000943378785401827949424372496086814723928666975699087613381522841125079937980500756
